meanings.definition: To sit or lie with the body and limbs spread out carelessly or awkwardly.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog likes to sprawl on the cool floor after a long walk.
meanings.sent2: The children sprawled on the grass, enjoying the warm sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to sprawl across the keyboard, interrupting the typing.
meanings.sent4: The vines sprawled across the fence, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The colorful flowers seemed to sprawl in all directions, creating a beautiful garden.

meanings.definition: To spread out over a large area in an untidy or irregular way.
meanings.sent1: The city seemed to sprawl endlessly, with buildings stretching far and wide.
meanings.sent2: The ivy sprawled across the old stone wall, giving it a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: The spilled paint began to sprawl across the canvas, creating a messy masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The shadows sprawled across the room as the sun set outside.
meanings.sent5: The branches of the tree sprawled outwards, providing shade on a hot day.

meanings.definition: An ungainly or carelessly relaxed position in which one's limbs are spread out.
meanings.sent1: The toddler fell into a sprawl on the floor, giggling at the sudden freedom.
meanings.sent2: The man in the waiting room slouched into a comfortable sprawl in the chair.
meanings.sent3: The yoga instructor demonstrated a challenging sprawl pose to the class.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's graceful movements transitioned into a dramatic sprawl on the stage.
meanings.sent5: The cat's playful sprawl on the windowsill caught the attention of passersby.
